election_record.label: Ohio 1822 Governor

overview.note: Allen Trimble had been serving as interim Governor since January 1822, due to the resignation of Ethan Allen Brown to take a seat in the U.S. Senate. Trimble had been the Speaker of the Senate, and presided as Governor until the next regular election in October.
Various sources list William W. Irvin as "William W. Irvin" or "William W. Irwin." Though spelled differently, these refer to the same individual.

The Official Certified Vote was Jeremiah Morrow with 26059 votes, Allen Trimble with 22899 votes and William W. Irvin with 11050 votes. The totals of 27430 for Jeremiah Morrow, 24361 for Allen Trimble and 11845 for William W. Irvin include Belmont and Richland counties and the rejected votes from Miami township in Clermont County.

"The returns from five counties were not received-among which are Belmont, Richland, and Wood. In the two former the votes stood- Morrow: 1181, Trimble 1457, Irvin 795." The Ohio Repository (Canton, OH).

sub_unit.name: Adams
sub_unit.note: The Ohio Repository (Canton, OH) lists Jeremiah Morrow with 403 votes.

sub_unit.name: Ashtabula
sub_unit.note: The Columbus Gazette (Columbus, OH) lists Jeremiah Morrow with 300 votes and Allen Trimble with 682 votes.
The Muskingum Messenger (Zanesville, OH) lists Jeremiah Morrow with 200 votes.

sub_unit.name: Belmont
sub_unit.note: The votes from Belmont County are not included in the Official Certified Vote.
The Columbus Gazette (Columbus, OH) lists Jeremiah Morrow with 941 votes.

sub_unit.name: Brown
sub_unit.note: The American Friend (Marietta, OH) litss William W. Irving with 10 votes.

sub_unit.name: Butler
sub_unit.note: The Ohio Repository (Canton, OH) lists Jeremiah Morrow with 1335 votes and William W. Irvin with 6 votes.
The American Friend (Marietta, OH) lists Jeremiah Morrow with 1135 votes and William W. Irvin with no votes.
The Hamilton Intelligencer and Liberty Hall and Cincinnati Gazette (Cincinnati, OH) lists William W. Irvin with no votes.
The Ohio Monitor and Patron of Industry (Columbus, OH) lists Jeremiah Morrow with 1825 votes.
The Western Star and Lebanon Gazette lists Jeremiah Morrow with 1836 votes.

sub_unit.name: Champaign
sub_unit.note: The Supporter and Scioto Gazette (Chillicothe, OH),Liberty Hall and Cincinnati Gazette (Cincinnati, OH), Muskingum Messenger (Zanesville, OH), and American Friend (Marietta, OH) list Jeremiah Morrow with 744 votes and Allen Trimble with 114 votes.
The Columbus Gazette (Columbus, OH) and the Liberty Hall and Cincinnati Gazette (Cincinnati, OH) list Allen Trimble with 114 votes and William W. Irvin with 5 votes.

sub_unit.name: Clark
sub_unit.note: The Supporter and Scioto Gazette (Chillicothe, OH) lists Allen Trimble with 428 votes.

sub_unit.name: Clermont
sub_unit.note: "Miami township has been rejected, owing to a mistake in the date of the poll-book, it being dated 1820 instead of 1822." Liberty Hall and Cincinnati Gazette (Cincinnati, OH).

"In consequence of an error in the returns from Miami township, the votes given there were lost. They are however included in the above statement, and were--For Jeremiah Morrow 190, Allen Trimble-5." Liberty Hall and Cincinnati Gazette (Cincinnati, OH).

Many newspapers list Jeremiah Morrow with 869 votes and Allen Trimble with 740 votes because they do not include the rejected votes from Miami township The Official Certified Vote includes the 869 and 740 figures.
The Columbus Gazette (Columbus, OH) and Ohio Monitor and Patron of Industry (Columbus, OH) list Allen Trimble with 705 votes and William W. Irvin with no votes.
The Hamilton Intelligencer lists Jeremiah Morrow with 860 votes

The Ohio Repository (Canton, OH),Cleaveland Herald (Cleveland, OH), Hamilton Intelligencer, Western Star and Lebanon Gazette, Ohio Monitor and Patron of Industry (Columbus, OH), American Friend (Marietta, OH), and Muskingum Messenger (Zanesville, OH) list William W. Irvin with no votes.

sub_unit.name: Clinton
sub_unit.note: The Ohio Repository (Canton, OH) lists Jeremiah Morrow with 336 votes.

sub_unit.name: Columbiana
sub_unit.note: The Columbus Gazette (Columbus, OH) lists William W. Irvin with 114 votes.
The Western Star and Lebanon Gazette lists William W. Irvin with 54 votes.

sub_unit.name: Coshocton
sub_unit.note: The Supporter and Scioto Gazette (Chillicothe, OH), American Friend (Marietta, OH), Western Star and Lebanon Gazette, Muskingum Messenger (Zanesville, OH), Ohio Monitor and Patron of Industry (Columbus, OH), Liberty Hall and Cincinnati Gazette (Cincinnati, OH), and The Ohio Repository (Canton, OH) list Allen Trimble and William W. Irvin with 113 votes each.
The Columbus Gazette (Columbus, OH) lists Allen Trimble with 118 votes and William W. Irvin with 113 votes.

sub_unit.name: Cuyahoga
sub_unit.note: The Cleaveland Herald (Cleveland, OH) of October 10, 1822 lists Jeremiah Morrow with 478 votes, Allen Trimble with 243 votes and William W. Irvin with no votes. This was corrected in the October 17 issue, but this is apparently where the incorrect numbers appear that were reprinted in numerous other newspapers.

The Supporter and Scioto Gazette (Chillicothe, OH), Columbus Gazette (Columbus, OH), Ohio Monitor and Patron of Industry (Columbus, OH) and Examiner (Washington, PA) list Jeremiah Morrow with 478 votes, Allen Trimble with 243 votes and William W. Irvin with no votes.
The Liberty Hall and Cincinnati Gazette (Cincinnati, OH) lists Jeremiah Morrow with 478 votes, Allen Trimble with 253 votes, and William W. Irvin with no votes.

The Ohio Repository (Canton, OH), Cleaveland Herald (Cleveland, OH), Muskingum Messenger (Zanesville, OH), and American Friend (Marietta, OH) list Jeremiah Morrow with 620 votes and William W. Irvin with 3 votes.

The Sandusky Clarion directly quotes the Cleaveland Herald (Cleveland, OH) and lists Jeremiah Morrow with 478 votes and Allen Trimble with 253 votes (this is a typographical error, as the Herald lists Allen Trimble with 243 votes).

sub_unit.name: Darke
sub_unit.note: The Muskingum Messenger (Zanesville, OH) and American Friend (Marietta, OH) list William W. Irvin with 1026 votes.
The Ohio Monitor and Patron of Industry (Columbus, OH) lists Allen Trimble with 155 votes.

sub_unit.name: Delaware
sub_unit.note: Some newspapers list "Delaware, Marion and Crawford." Marion and Crawford counties were created out of Delaware County in 1820, but were not organized with an official county government until later, and, until then, all votes were counted with the votes from Delaware County.

sub_unit.name: Fairfield
sub_unit.note: The Supporter and Scioto Gazette (Chillicothe, OH), Liberty Hall and Cincinnati Gazette (Cincinnati, OH), Ohio Monitor and Patron of Industry (Columbus, OH), Western Star and Lebanon Gazette and American Friend (Marietta, OH) list Jeremiah Morrow with 83 votes.
The Columbus Gazette (Columbus, OH) lists Jeremiah Morrow with 37 votes.
The American Friend (Marietta, OH) lists William W. Irvin with 1818 votes.

sub_unit.name: Fayette
sub_unit.note: The Supporter and Scioto Gazette (Chillicothe, OH), The Ohio Repository (Canton, OH), Western Star and Lebanon Gazette, Liberty Hall and Cincinnati Gazette (Cincinnati, OH), American Friend (Marietta, OH), Muskingum Messenger (Zanesville, OH), Ohio Monitor and Patron of Industry (Columbus, OH) and Columbus Gazette (Columbus, OH) list Allen Trimble with 644 votes.
The Ohio Repository (Canton, OH) lists Jeremiah Morrow with 157 votes.

sub_unit.name: Franklin
sub_unit.note: The Supporter and Scioto Gazette (Chillicothe, OH), Liberty Hall and Cincinnati Gazette (Cincinnati, OH), Western Star and Lebanon Gazette, Muskingum Messenger (Zanesville, OH), and Columbus Gazette (Columbus, OH) list Jeremiah Morrow with 399 votes, Allen Trimble with 459 votes and William W. Irvin with 674 votes.
The Ohio Repository (Canton, OH) lists Jeremiah Morrow with 399 votes, Allen Trimble with 459 votes and William W. Irvin with 744 votes.
The American Friend (Marietta, OH) lists Jeremiah Morrow with 399 votes, Allen Trimble with 452 votes and William W. Irvin with 674 votes.

sub_unit.name: Gallia
sub_unit.note: The Columbus Gazette (Columbus, OH) lists Allen Trimble with 216 votes.
The Hamilton Intelligencer lists Jeremiah Morrow with 105 votes.

sub_unit.name: Greene
sub_unit.note: The Columbus Gazette (Columbus, OH) lists Jeremiah Morrow with 685 votes.

sub_unit.name: Hamilton
sub_unit.note: The American Friend (Marietta, OH) does not list any votes for William W. Irvin.
The Hamilton Intelligencer and Liberty Hall and Cincinnati Gazette (Cincinnati, OH) lists 3122 votes for Jeremiah Morrow.
The Ohio Monitor and Patron of Industry (Columbus, OH) lists Allen Trimble with 1185 votes.

sub_unit.name: Harrison
sub_unit.note: The American Friend (Marietta, OH) lists Jeremiah Morrow with 131 votes.
The Muskingum Messenger (Zanesville, OH) lists Allen Trimble with 1005 votes.

sub_unit.name: Highland
sub_unit.note: The Official Certified Vote does not list any votes for William W. Irvin.
The Supporter and Scioto Gazette (Chillicothe, OH) and the Sandusky Clarion do not list any votes for William W. Irvin.
The Ohio Repository (Canton, OH) lists Allen Trimble with 931 votes.
The Ohio Monitor and Patron of Industry (Columbus, OH) lists Jeremiah Morrow with 507 votes.
Addition of the township returns for Highland county yields 241 votes for Jeremiah Morrow.

sub_unit.name: Hocking
sub_unit.note: The Supporter and Scioto Gazette (Chillicothe, OH), American Friend (Marietta, OH), Western Star and Lebanon Gazette, Muskingum Messenger (Zanesville, OH), Columbus Gazette (Columbus, OH), and Ohio Monitor and Patron of Industry (Columbus, OH) list William W. Irvin with 118 votes.
The Ohio Repository (Canton, OH) lists William W. Irvin with 113 votes.
The Liberty Hall and Cincinnati Gazette (Cincinnati, OH) lists no votes for Allen Trimble or William W. Irvin.

sub_unit.name: Huron
sub_unit.note: The Supporter and Scioto Gazette (Chillicothe, OH), Liberty Hall and Cincinnati Gazette (Cincinnati, OH), The Ohio Repository (Canton, OH), Muskingum Messenger (Zanesville, OH), Sandusky Clarion, Ohio Monitor and Patron of Industry (Columbus, OH) and Columbus Gazette (Columbus, OH) list lists Allen Trimble with 470 votes.
The Ohio Monitor and Patron of Industry (Columbus, OH) lists Jeremiah Morrow with 35 votes and William W. Irvin with 812 votes.
In addition to the 312 votes for William W. Irvin, there were 2 for William W. Irwin.

sub_unit.name: Jefferson
sub_unit.note: The Western Star and Lebanon Gazette lists Jeremiah Morrow with 151 votes, Allen Trimble with 1389 votes and William W. Irvin with no votes.
The Hamilton Intelligencer lists Jeremiah Morrow with 351 votes.

sub_unit.name: Licking
sub_unit.note: The Ohio Monitor and Patron of Industry (Columbus, OH) lists Allen Trimble with 268 votes.
The Muskingum Messenger (Zanesville, OH) lists William W. Irvin with 99 votes.

sub_unit.name: Logan
sub_unit.note: The American Friend (Marietta, OH) lists Jeremiah Morrow with 261 votes and William W. Irvin with no votes.
The Muskingum Messenger (Zanesville, OH) does not list any votes for William W. Irvin.

sub_unit.name: Medina
sub_unit.note: The Supporter, Muskingum Messenger (Zanesville, OH), Ohio Monitor and Patron of Industry (Columbus, OH), Cleaveland Herald (Cleveland, OH), The Ohio Repository (Canton, OH) and Columbus Gazette (Columbus, OH) do not list any votes for William W. Irvin.
The Ohio Repository (Canton, OH) lists Jeremiah Morrow with 18 votes.
The Columbus Gazette (Columbus, OH) and Ohio Monitor and Patron of Industry (Columbus, OH) list Jeremiah Morrow with 119 votes.

sub_unit.name: Miami
sub_unit.note: The Supporter and Scioto Gazette (Chillicothe, OH) and Muskingum Messenger (Zanesville, OH) list Jeremiah Morrow with 536 votes, Allen Trimble with 266 votes and William W. Irvin with 32 votes.

sub_unit.name: Montgomery
sub_unit.note: The Supporter and Scioto Gazette (Chillicothe, OH), Liberty Hall and Cincinnati Gazette (Cincinnati, OH), and Western Star and Lebanon Gazette do not list any votes for William W. Irvin.

sub_unit.name: Morgan
sub_unit.note: The Western Spy, and Literary Cadet (Cincinnati, OH) and Sandusky Clarion list Jeremiah Morrow with 459 votes.

sub_unit.name: Muskingum
sub_unit.note: The Liberty Hall and Cincinnati Gazette (Cincinnati, OH) and Hamilton Intelligencer list Jeremiah Morrow with 1643 votes.

sub_unit.name: Pickaway
sub_unit.note: The American Friend (Marietta, OH) lists William W. Irvin with 424 votes.
The Muskingum Messenger (Zanesville, OH) lists William W. Irvin with 142 votes.

sub_unit.name: Portage
sub_unit.note: The Ohio Monitor and Patron of Industry (Columbus, OH) lists Jeremiah Morrow with 883 votes and William W. Irwin with 15 votes.

sub_unit.name: Richland
sub_unit.note: The votes from Richland County are not included in the Official Certified Vote.
The Ohio Monitor and Patron of Industry (Columbus, OH) lists Jeremiah Morrow with 233 votes.

sub_unit.name: Sandusky
sub_unit.note: Many newspapers list "Sandusky and Seneca." Seneca County was created out of Sandusky County in 1820, but it was not organized with an official county government until 1824, and all votes up to that point were counted with the votes from Sandusky County.
Sandusky Clarion (Sandusky, OH) reports 12 votes for William W. Irwin and 81 votes for William W. Irvin.

The Supporter and Scioto Gazette (Chillicothe, OH) and Ohio Monitor and Patron of Industry (Columbus, OH) list Jeremiah Morrow with 3 votes, Allen Trimble with 24 votes and William W. Irvin with 138 votes.
The Examiner (Washington, PA) and Columbus Gazette (Columbus, OH) list Jeremiah Morrow with 3 votes, Allen Trimble with 27 votes and William W. Irvin with 153 votes.
The Muskingum Messenger (Zanesville, OH) lists Jeremiah Morrow with 3 votes, Allen Trimble with 153 votes, and William W. Irvin with 27 votes.

"We were in hopes that some one would have furnished us with a complete statement of the votes given in each town in Sandusky and Seneca counties; but as that has not been done, we can only give the following general result, which we are informed is correct." Sandusky Clarion (Sandusky, OH).

sub_unit.name: Shelby
sub_unit.note: The Columbus Gazette (Columbus, OH) lists Jeremiah Morrow with 203 votes.

sub_unit.name: Stark
sub_unit.note: The Ohio Repository (Canton, OH) lists Allen Trimble with 168 votes, but the township totals add up to 150 votes.
The American Friend (Marietta, OH) lists no votes for William W. Irvin.

sub_unit.name: Tuscarawas
sub_unit.note: The Ohio Repository (Canton, OH) lists Jeremiah Morrow with 496 votes.
The Ohio Monitor and Patron of Industry (Columbus, OH) lists Allen Trimble with 108 votes.

sub_unit.name: Warren
sub_unit.note: The Liberty Hall and Cincinnati Gazette (Cincinnati, OH), The Supporter and Scioto Gazette (Chillicothe, OH), Herald (Cleaveland), and Columbus Gazette (Columbus, OH) do not list any votes for William W. Irvin.
Cleaveland Herald (Cleveland, OH) and the Sandusky Clarion list Allen Trimble with 180 votes.
The Sandusky Clarion lists Jeremiah Morrow with 1106 votes.

sub_unit.name: Washington
sub_unit.note: The Supporter (Chilllicothe) lists Jeremiah Morrow with 463 votes.
The Muskingum Messenger (Zanesville, OH) lists Jeremiah Morrow with 488 votes.
The Ohio Monitor and Patron of Industry (Columbus, OH) lists Jeremiah Morrow with 458 votes.
The Western Spy, and Literary Cadet (Cincinnati, OH) lists William W. Irvin with 140 votes.

sub_unit.name: Decatur
sub_unit.note: "No returns from this township" American Friend (Marietta, OH).
